page.title: 05Railway Station,Pontypridd
page.content: Pontypridd was once the heart of the Taff Vale Railway.It was one of the busiest railway centres in the British Isles but since 1970 the great days have gone.The station now only has one passenger line although the two mineral lines remain.At Pontypridd signal box,just past the station, the line divides in two:one line runs to Merthyr Tydfil and the other runs up the Rhondda valley to Treherbert. Trains run hourly during the daytime on both these lines.There is a regular service from Pontypridd to Cardiff. Recently a brand new train,the Sprinter 150,was seen in Pontypridd. This is Britain's newest passenger train.It means a faster journey,it is quick but quiet.Maybe this train would make Pontypridd station busy again. (By a pupil of Trefforest CP school)
